授業方法: Lecture and discussion of reading assignments.

第1回: Introduction to Premodern Japanese Literature, Overview of the Course
第3回: Heian Literature I: Ki no Tsurayuki and the Development of Kana Literature (Tosa Diary & Kokinshū)
第4回: Heian Literature II: The Tale of Genji
第5回: Heian Literature III: Pillow Book & Sarashina Diary
第13回: Edo Literature: Matsuo Basho (The Narrow Road to Oku)
第14回: In this class, we will discuss the books themselves, rather than their contents. Students will try their hand at putting together a book in one of the traditional styles.
トピック.授業外学習2: Every week, we will discuss Japanese literature using English translations of important texts. There will be reading and visual materials for the topic provided by the instructor through LUNA. Students will be expected to read these materials before class and be prepared to actively discuss them.

参考書/Reference books1: Seeds in the Heart: Japanese Literature from Earliest Times to the Late Sixteenth Century
参考書/Reference books3: おくのほそ道 (Oku no Hosomichi)
成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: There will be a quiz in class each week based on the previous week's reading and lecture.
成績評価Grading2: Students will write an essay at the end of the semester about a text or topic that interests them. Grades will be based on: originality, logical structure, effective use of quotations from a work of literature, proper use of citation and reference materials.
成績評価Grading3: 授業外学修課題／Assignment, homework required outside class (06)
Students will post questions and comments on LUNA for each week's readings.
成績評価Grading4: 授業への参加度（自発性、積極性、主体性、等）／In-class participation,contribution (09)

Throughout the semester, students will research characters, places, or concepts that intrigue them in the readings. Students will take turns helping to lead in-class discussions by making short presentations about their research findings in class.
